name: Jamaica Breeze Buffet
address: 21-36 Mott Ave, Far Rockaway, NY 11691, USA

reviews.text: Great Jamaican food.

This restaurant has been in the neighborhood for quite a while and I like it very much. I enjoy the food and itâ€™s a nice and clean place. I really really enjoy the food. Itâ€™s a great restaurant to have in the neighborhood.

I bought stew peas with pig tail no rice hoping to enjoy it with my brown rice at home. The stew was extremely salty not even a drunkard would've eaten it.I took it back in hopes of getting something else for my $11.54 I paid in cash.I was asked for a receipt which I did not keep and was told there's nothing that can be done without a receipt.The receipt and gloves were thrown in the garbage as I left not knowing the horrible food would be a waste of my money.I'll go across the street to Ralph's where the food it not reheated and sold as fresh.
Never had a Jamaica buffet before. I loved it

What a joke! This unorganized buffet had a lot of food which was largely unlabeled. I got the oxtails & when I asked for salt & pepper, the server said they had none. What the hell? I asked to use the restroom to wash my hands only to discover they had no restroom. I asked for hand wipes & again they had none. Shame on whoever manages this dive.

This place is decent but they charge your food by the pound, based on the most expensive thing on your plate. So 90% of the time you end up getting overcharged and spending way more than the what the amount of food is actually worth. The flavors of the food are 8/10 but the price isnâ€™t worth it to be honest.
Cashier was rude as hell which it low key kind of ruined my dineing experience
whenever in far rockaway ğŸ¤™

This place has the worst food in Far Rockaway. By far, you can't keep reheating the food every day anÌˆd expect people to buy this stuff and the service is a joke they need a New cook.Now if you want Good food just walk across the street that spot stays busy and the plates and prices are right.
Food made my family and I sick twice. Iâ€™m not gonna make it be a third time!

I don't eat at Jamaica Breeze Buffet.  But when I do I enjoy the food.  Today I bought the Stew Peas and it was very salty ğŸ§‚  and the pigtails was not tender.  I would of brought it back to get my money back but was already home and too cold outside.  I don't think I will be eating there again.ğŸ˜¡
I got mac and cheese, curry chicken foot and cabbage. Absolutely nothing had any flavor. I was so disappointed.
Rice always stale, my last time going after I was sick eating it vomiting diarrhea and pain never again
Food is ok, a nice variety to choose from. A little pricey. Goes by the pound.

The food is very delicious, but itâ€™s overly priced I went in twice I get in almost the same thing the first time $60 but I was able to get pastry and a drink the second time no drink or pastry and it was almost $100 And it was for two people only thatâ€™s ridiculous
Good food
That white rice in not even cooked

We were visiting NY and stopped at this restaurant on a Saturday morning. The food is by weight and can be expensive depending on what you choose.  It's self service in that you have to put on gloves and serve yourself depending on whatâ€¦

The Food is okay depending what you buy from here. However, they use way to much oil in alot of the dishes. Ive purchased Ackee and Saltfish that has just made me nauseous after a few bites of it and ended up throwing it out. Stop drowing the food in oil.
The food was good and price was reasonable. I donâ€™t know what they all saying. I enjoyed it, I will be back
No good ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ workers are rude food is trash

This is my 2nd time eating here. They need multiple people to provide food quality evaluations before it gets put out being that itâ€™s so many options. I shared food and didnâ€™t realize until I was eating the food that the chicken still had feathers on it, mainly because it was a cover in sauce. That made me nauseous once I seen it, almost threw up. Whoâ€™s to say the chicken was cleaned properly?! This establishment needs people who would like to be at work or at least somewhat friendly to customers. Service is so minimum but yet disgusting, similar if not a little worst than the food preparations. Why must customers receive a horrid/ nasty attitudes while spending THEIR money with this establishment nobody begging or asking.
The food is good, but it's so expensive ğŸ˜«
Amazing! Cater all the time.
Good vegetarian selections. They make you wear gloves when collecting the buffet food which is a very hygienic practice.
The cashier was very pleasant
Depends who is at register for service and the food used to me good but now like the cool getting tired or lazy idk but I threw a whole two trays of food out yesterday smfh pissed off
Nice place
Great place
Nice selection but overpriced

EXTREMELY INCONSISTENT QUALITY!!!  Went there two months & everything was sooooo good that I raved about it to everyone.  A 12 on a scale of 1-10.  That experience was so good that I went back a week later. It was all different. Gave it a 4-5 on a 1-10 scale. Went back a 3rd time, same disappointment. Don't they know consistency is the name of the take-out game.  Won't play "Russian Roulette" with my money. One time it's good, the next time not. NO WAY will I continue to be a customer.  It's a shame because the first time was absolutely fantastic!!  GET IT TOGETHER JAMAICAN BREEZE!!
The older lady with the blonde hair s so disgusting you donâ€™t even want the food
The food was ok needs more flavor
Rockaway doesnâ€™t have much Restaurants so we are forced to settle for this. Wouldnâ€™t feed my dogs this.
Wouldnâ€™t recommend. Service just as nasty as the food. No joke
This was absolutely amazing food.
Checkout my review on YouTube. Search Cokeboy280
All the food prepared was great. When one pan was almost empty the staff members replaced them as soon as possible.

One of the cleanest restaurants. I claim that because patrons have to wear plastic gloves to serve from the steam table. Food is weighed per pound and price of the small container was literally similar as other Jamaican restaurants. I tried the jerk chicken and the spiciness was on point and juicy

This restaurant has some really good food. If you go early morning you can catch all the fresh food.  They also make their own buns and breads. My only downfall to this place is the price . THEY will over charge you if you take spoonful ofâ€¦

Jamaican food + Buffet???
ğŸ˜±Shut up and take my money! ğŸ˜ğŸ¤¤ğŸ˜‹

A real gem. The food is savory and the price is good & affordable when you compare it to how much is on your plate. You could mess around and walk right by this place if youâ€™re not careful.

The food is always good,  very consistent as well. However,  The place is always steaming hot even when it's the summertime. Workers stare you down with no smile or hello. The hand sanitizing rule isn't forced like once before and peopleâ€¦

If zero stars was possible!!! The owner of this business she always have an attitude when someone ask her something. The first time my mother and I went my mother just asked why is she being charge so much if itâ€™s buffets style meaning you could get whatever you want for a certain price but NO she charge extra for more than one choice of meat and she said you have to get a meal so itâ€™s not a buffet style itâ€™s pretty much serve yourself. Now today we go get lunch and my mother wanted to use her card. The lady who was ringing us out  said the charge have to be $10 on a card my mother food came up to $9.21 and before my mother was never told it had to be $10 to charge her card. So the lady told the owner and the owner started to get loud while explaining that it has to be $10 on the card and pointing to a sign thatâ€™s ripped up ğŸ¤¦ğŸ¾â€â™€ï¸ We continue to make the purchase and the owner is rolling her eyes so I took my mother card out the machine and told her to have a nice day because as an owner you need to set the example for your staff and being nasty to your customers is not the way. As we walked away she started to talk about us with her staff and another customer. Which is really unprofessional and rude. I will never eat here again and this is why you canâ€™t support black businesses because the owner always have an attitude with the people who support them to keep the lights on. Plus the food looked dry and not good at all.

I don't usually do the rating thing but I do appreciate good food. You can go places and clearly see that they let food get stale, dry from being out with the heat at a buffet. But These people constantly stir the food, bring out fresh keepâ€¦

Good Jamaican Buffet, food is not spicy though. They have a variety, food is per pound based on what protein you are getting. Its self serve and they provide gloves for you to use prior to serving yourself. I've been eating here for the last 3 months, food is good. My only complaint is the oxtail and goat are not trimmed before cooking, but other than that..best spot for jamaican food out here

I used to come to this restaurant all the time , Idk if they switched chefs today but the curry goat was watery and the rice and peas was very mushy and some had burnt parts..I wasnâ€™t satisfied with my meal at all today .. Iâ€™m giving 3 stars because they did way better in the past. Also , I donâ€™t like how the employees stare you down while you make your plate.
Very good food, only thing I didn't like was the curry chicken, the meat was still a little pink. Also their prices are pretty high. Other than that they keep the place clean, and the staff are nice!

Great choices in Jamaican dishes, but I was very disappointed in their chicken soup I bought at one time. The soup was not fresh and the chicken tasted sour and spoiled like it was cooked the previous day and the dumplings were mushy andâ€¦

The food is tasty, however it's pricey. I just left there, and I was charged $16. and some change for 3 pieces of curry chicken, a small portion of white rice topped with stew peas, a small portion of mixed vegetables and 2 shrimp and the women behind the counter said I have more meat in my plate than anything else, my niece who was with me had 4 pieces of curry chicken and some rice and peas and her meal only came up to $6. and change. This business should really specify how they charge...is it by weight or what you have in your plate?! The cost is really at their discretion, so I would be mindful of this. I really should've just left the plate on the counter and walked out! I also noticed that a customer beside me..had a plate full of oxtail and rice and his order came up to $10 and change...since when is beef less expensive than chicken??? Smh.

The food is always so darn good but Iâ€™m convinced they charge you based on whether they like you or not because I get different prices all the the time. Some occasions more over priced than others. We usually just rock with the priceâ€¦

Moved from Rochester to ny and this is actually the best Jamaican food Iâ€™ve came across yet. Unfortunately just left and the lady at the register attitude is terrible. Very rude and not friendly whatsoever will never go back donâ€™t care if Iâ€¦

3/9/21 Around 2pm

Cashier had a nasty attitude. She placed the food and utensils so awkwardly thatâ€¦

Recently found out by accident that Jamaica Breeze charges your credit card a higher amount than it shows on the itemized register receipt given to the customer!  The itemized register receipt given to the customer will say â€œcashâ€ (even though credit card was used),  but the amount they run through the credit card machine includes a 3% â€œservice chargeâ€ you donâ€™t know about - until after the sale is completed (if you catch it/notice the price difference later).  While I was still in the store, I received a notification on my Apple watch about the transaction & noticed the amount was higher than the receipt given to me.  When I asked about it, I was told they keep the receipt that shows the extra charge.  WTH!!!  I asked for the manager.  While waiting on the side for the manager, I noticed a tiny sign not in a conspicuous location that said a 3% service charge is added to â€œall transactionsâ€ - but itâ€™s actually added only to credit card transactions.  The manager refused to let me take a picture of the sale receipt that showed the higher amount charged to my credit card; manager also took my itemized receipt that showed the lower amount and refused to give it back to me after I asked her to return it to me.  BEWARE OF THIS!

Receipt given to customer should reflect total amount charged to credit card and there should be a big sign in a very conspicuous place informing customers of this!!  I decided to check my other receipts when I got home and found out that had happened before but I didnâ€™t catch it.  Unfortunately I donâ€™t have all my receipts from other past purchases to see how far back this deception has been going on.  The tiny sign has not always been there.

I donâ€™t have a problem paying a reasonable service fee sometimes for using my credit card if Iâ€™m aware of the policy and decide at the moment I will pay with a credit card because I donâ€™t have enough cash - but it should be a decision I make based on the policy Iâ€™m made aware of.  If I was aware on the day I discovered what was being done, I would have paid with cash.  The food (which is good) is pricey enough without having to also pay a service charge!

I wonâ€™t be going back to Jamaica Breeze - not because of the service charge policy, but because of the deception and the manager refusing to give me back my receipt with the lower amount and refusing to let me take a picture of the store receipt that had the higher amount!  Why not??  I was a loyal customer for a long while - but it goes both ways.  I donâ€™t like being deceived or handled in the way I was when I asked for original sale receipts.

Don't go there in the summertime to eat in.  There is NO A/C and the buffet is right in the middle of the seating area,making it feel like your eating in a sauna. The staff are dripping with sweat, including the ones restocking the foodâ€¦

This is the best Jamaican Buffet in the area. Their oxtails and macaroni and cheese and cheesecake are my 3 top favorite dishes. They have so much more to choose from. Their carrot juice is famous in the neighborhood. Gotta catch it beforeâ€¦

Food is great clean settings area have been kept clean after several customers share food  workers are polite and mannerable and I must add you can always find delicious food that you crave or have not eaten in a while thanks
I would give 5 stars if the prices were a bit cheaper. Besides that, the food is awesome!! Very neat place to eat at, but beware!! The line can get incredibly long!
